intro: Soldanella alpina var. major, commonly known as the Alpine soldanella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clustered, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically features dark green, oval leaves with a hairy surface and produces pale pink to white flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
